t: Now that schools are reopened to all students, what do you identify as the key challenge(s) of your day-to-day life as a teacher?

responses.t: Identifying gaps in children’s learning and working out how to assist those in need of extra support
Having to re-teach knowledge/skills from before lockdown
Designing remote learning resources for isolating pupils/future lockdowns
Answering Covid-19 related questions from pupils
Implementing hygiene and social distancing routines
Increased evidence gathering of pupils’ progress to back up my teacher judgements
Dealing with high levels of bullying and/or truancy
Supporting pupils whose emotional health and mental well-being is suffering
Supporting children who are socially and/or economically vulnerable
Not relevant / cannot answer

t: Which of the following most closely describes your current mental health and wellbeing?

responses.t: I’m completely happy and confident in respect to my work
I’m mostly happy and confident in respect to my work
I’m slightly anxious and stressed because of my work
I’m anxious and stressed because of my work
I’m very anxious and stressed because of my work
I’m completely overwhelmed by my work challenges
I’m seriously concerned about my poor mental health caused by my work
Not relevant / cannot answer

t: In your opinion, what proportion of the pupils you teach are currently behind in their learning? Tick the response that most closely applies.

responses.t: answer one
answer two
answer three

t: What proportion of the students you teach are having a *successful* learning experience during lockdown, i.e. learning *as much or more* than they would if they were in school?

responses.t: No students are having a very successful learning experience
1-in-30 (e.g. 1 in a class)
1-in-10 (e.g. 3 in a class)
1-in-5 (e.g. 6 in a class)
1-in-2 (about half the class)
3-in-4 (three quarters of the class)
Almost all the students I teach are having a very successful learning experience
All the students I teach are having a very successful learning experience
I don't know who is having a successful learning experience
Not relevant / cannot answer
